description.narrative: The aim of this research is to investigate the technical and financial feasibility of the modernization and renovation of the port infrastructure of the port of Alexandria in Egypt. The implementation must be climate-proof. The port has also set itself the goal of developing into a Green Port. The intended buyer is the Alexandria Port Authority (APA) where the research will be conducted by CDR International B.V.. The port of Alexandria is one of the oldest port in the world and serves as the main port of Egypt. The required capital for a feasibility study is not available at the APA. That is why this grant application is submitted.The modernization and renovation involves an export amount of around 100 million euros. This estimate is based on rough key figures. The research must provide insight into whether and how modernization and renovation can be technically, nautically, operationally and financially justified, taking into account a neutral or positive environmental and climate-proof approach. The research will lead to a go or no-go decision for the implementation of the project.The modernization and renovation of the port will lead to a significant increase in the throughput and transfer capacity of the port. This will be realized, among other things, until the port is deepened to a minimum of 17 m, so that a new generation of ships can dock in the port. The quay walls must be renovated for this. The modernization will be accompanied by the transition to a green port (green port) to meet the climate objective set by the Ministry of Transport of Egypt. The modernization will lead to a structural increase in the number of CDR employees to around 20. The number of jobs created by direct and indirect employment is expected to be in the order of 1,500, part of which during construction and part during the operational phase.After completion of the study, CDR International B.V. expects an export of around 6 million euros. This amount is based on a typical percentage of the design costs in relation to the investment costs.
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of companies with a supported plan to invest, trade or provide services - Dutch companies
